# Australia and Türkiye fighting to host COP31 climate summit

- [D\
\
By David Speers](https://www.abc.net.au/news/david-speers/11841154)
- [Topic:Environmental Policy](https://www.abc.net.au/news/topic/environmental-policy)

Sat 6 SepSaturday 6 SeptemberSat 6 Sep 2025 at 8:00pm

Brazil will host the COP30 climate summit in November 2025. (Reuters: Maxim Shemetov)

## In short:

Australia and Türkiye are fighting over who will host the COP31 climate summit in November 2026.

Australia wants to host the summit in Adelaide to showcase its clean energy transition.

## What's next?

Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese is planning to meet Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan this month in New York to resolve the dispute.

search_results.title: COP31 Collaboration
search_results.text:
_**We believe COP31 can be a catalyst for communities, businesses, social groups, individuals and families to participate in realising climate action – leaving behind the mire of climate wars, and moving co-operatively into new opportunities.**_

**In late 2022, Australia announced its bid to co-host the 31st Conference of the Parties to the UN’s Framework Convention on Climate Change (COP31) in 2026 in partnership with the Pacific.**

It is on this basis that like-minded leaders from across charities and local community; Aboriginal, Torres Strait Islander and Pacific communities; climate and environment; business and investment; policy and research are coming together with the objective of supporting a whole-of-society approach to COP31.

We hope you will join us.

Together we will seek to connect people, planet, peace and prosperity into narratives, actions and advocacy that sees COP31 deliver a just, resilient, low carbon future.

## The Maximum Ambition Coalition (MAX)

### COP31 is an opportunity for Australia to shine as a global leader in effective climate action.

##### **Share**

## 1\. Introduction

### Australia’s bid to host the 31st Conference of the Parties (COP31) in partnership with Pacific Island nations in 2026 presents a transformational opportunity to lift climate ambition and unlock action on climate change mitigation in our region and beyond.

Climateworks is working with partners in the Maximum Ambition Coalition (MAX) to leverage Australia’s comparative advantage in the lead-up to COP31.

**What we are doing**

MAX is an action-oriented coalition supporting Australia to deliver a successful COP31 in partnership with Pacific Island nations that aligns with the Paris Agreement’s goals to limit global warming to 1.5 degrees Celsius while increasing prosperity.

search_results.title: COP31 is an unprecedented opportunity for Australia

metadata.title: Which country will host the 31st Conference of the Parties (COP 31) in 2026?
metadata.description:
The host country for the annual [Conference of the Parties](https://unfccc.int/process/bodies/supreme-bodies/conference-of-the-parties-cop) (COP) rotates among the five UN regional groups. For [COP 31](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Nations_Climate_Change_Conference#2026:_COP_31/CMP_21/CMA_8), scheduled for November 2026, the [Western European and Others Group](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Western_European_and_Others_Group) (WEOG) is currently scheduled to host the conference. There are two main bids from countries within the WEOG group:

Australia is proposing to co-host the event in partnership with Pacific island nations. The Australian Commonwealth Government has designated Adelaide as its preferred host city, with South Australia actively committing funds and conducting feasibility studies.

Turkey is the only other country in the WEOG group to officially put forward a bid. The coastal city of [Antalya is widely speculated](https://ab.csb.gov.tr/en/turkiye-bids-to-host-cop31-with-the-goal-of-a-sustainable-future-news-295266) to be the likely host location if Turkey's bid is successful.

The decision is made by consensus among the WEOG member states. If a consensus cannot be reached, the conference would be held at the default host city of Bonn, Germany, which houses the headquarters of the [UNFCCC](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Nations_Framework_Convention_on_Climate_Change) secretariat. A final decision is expected to be reached before COP 30 in late 2025.

`{"format":"metac_reveal_and_close_in_period","info":{"post_id":40236,"question_id":39778}}`
metadata.resolution_criteria: The question will resolve as the home country of the announced host city for the 31st session of the Conference of the Parties (COP 31) in 2026, according to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) secretariat.
metadata.fine_print:
In the case of a joint bid by multiple countries, the question will resolve as the country where the main conference venue will be located.

A country will be considered a Pacific island nation if it is a member of the [Pacific Island Forum](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pacific_Islands_Forum#Membership).

If no host country is announced before January 1, 2026, this question will be annulled.
